2W0141








[solution]		 _____ 2W0142








[solution]      [Next]
2W0143








[solution]		 _____ 2W0144








[solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0141
    • 1. Ne6!! threatens 2. Qc7 mate and
    • the black queen

    		_____
  • 2W0142
    • 1. Qxe6!!! Qxe6 2. Nf8+ forks the
    • king and queen.

  • 2W0143
    • 1. Rxf6 and now not 1. ... Kxf6
    • because of 2. Bg5+

    		_____
  • 2W0144
    • 1. Rd6 with the dual threat of 2.
    • Rxd7 and 2. Qxa8+

    2W0145








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0146








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0147








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0148








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0145
    • 1. Rxd7+ Kxd7 2. Be6+ forks the
    • king and the rook.

    		_____
  • 2W0146
    • 1. Nc6+ double check wins the black
    • queen on move 2.

  • 2W0147
    • 1. Qxf7+ Kxf7 2. Bg6+ skewers the
    • king to the rook.

    		_____
  • 2W0148
    • the easy way is 1. Kf2! or Kf3 and
    • then 2. Rh1 mate.

    2W0149








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0150








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0151








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0152








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0149
    • 1. Bxg6 threatens Qh7 mate. If Re7
    • then 2. Qxf8 mate

    		_____
  • 2W0150
    • 1. Ba5 and 2. Bxc7+. If 1. ...
    • Qxa5 2. Qd7 mate.

  • 2W0151
    • 1. Rb1 and one of the knights will
    • be lost on move 2.

    		_____
  • 2W0152
    • 1. Rxf7+ Qxf7 2. Qxf7 mate. Also
    • 1. Qxf7+ works too.

    2W0153








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0154








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0155








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0156








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0153
    • 1. Rxe8+ and if either Nxe8 or Kc7
    • then 2. Qd8 mate.

    		_____
  • 2W0154
    • 1. Qh5 threatening both Qh7 mate
    • and Qh8 mate on move 2.

  • 2W0155
    • 1. Rg8+ removes the defend on the
    • black queen on move 2.

    		_____
  • 2W0156
    • In a bullet game Black over looked
    • 1. Kg6 and 2. Nf7 mate.

    2W0157








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0158








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0159








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0160








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0157
    • 1. Qd5+ and then 2. Qa8+ skewers
    • the King
    • and Queen.

    		_____
  • 2W0158
    • The easy way is 1. Re4+ and now if
    • 1. ... Kc5 2. Qd4 mate.

  • 2W0159
    • 1. Qe6+ king moves and 2. Qf5+
    • forks the king and the rook.

    		_____
  • 2W0160
    • 1. Bc2 and 2. Qxd4+ Not much
    • good is 1. ... Qb2 2. Qxd4+
